title: Latest on the severe weather in northern England - BBC News
summary: dozens of severe flood warnings in place , meaning potential risk to lives .
major disruption on roads and railways and properties without power .

documents.title: our coverage of the severe weather
text: we have come to the end of this live page for today but updates throughout the night can be found here .
cumbria will be broadcasting throughout the night to keep you up to date on the weather and floods across cumbria .
you can listen to us live online here or on 95.6fm .

documents.title: flooding in lakeside , windermere
text: mick callaghan emailed this and said : `` the boat is in the lake and the car is in the car park , lakeside , windermere . ''
he also sent this of the lakeside hotel , nearby .

documents.title: hospitals cancel all outpatient appointments
text: all routine outpatient appointments and most non-urgent elective operations scheduled to take place at the royal lancaster infirmary , westmorland general hospital and queen victoria hospital on monday have been cancelled .
only urgent operations will be carried out at the hospital , the trust said .

documents.title: united utilities investigate lancaster supply issue
text: united utilities tells its customers it is investigating an apparent fault in the la2 postcode area of lancaster .
the customers affected have reported no water or poor pressure .

documents.title: the view from lancashire
text: i 've been in lancaster to the sub-station where they had hoped to prevent what has been called once-in-a-century flooding .
a shopkeeper remained open by candlelight , as he was without electricity .
author: Ian Haslam
Reporter, BBC North West Tonight

documents.title: three bridges 'washed away ' by floods
text: cumbria police have confirmed three bridges in the county have been `` washed away '' by the floods .
a bridge near braithwaite , fitz footbridge in keswick , and pooley bridge in the eden district have collapsed .
more remain closed or damaged and police are reminding motorists and pedestrians to avoid bridges submerged by water until they have been checked .

documents.title: reception centres open through the night
text: reception centres across # cumbria being kept open through the night to offer advice and shelter .
more info here -

documents.title: 'amazing ' response to flooding fundraising page
text: there has been an amazing response to a fundraising page set up to help those affected by the flooding in cumbria .
it is already soaring towards the £ 100,000 mark .
author: Steven Bell
BBC Cumbria reporter

documents.title: the risks of driving through floodwater
text: the environment agency warns drivers to take care in floodwater as just 2ft of water `` will float your car . ''

documents.title: all you need to know about flood-cancelled hospital clinics
text: some clinics due to take place at the royal lancaster infirmary tomorrow are now cancelled .
find out which clinics :

documents.title: army help carlisle rescue
text: the army deployed personnel from weeton barracks , near preston , to help the flood rescue effort .
an elderly woman was carried to safety by soldiers and a crew from the rnli .

documents.title: 'stunned at the impact ' - senior police officer
text: one in a thousand event twice in my career # 2009cumbriafloods and # 2015cumbriafloods .
i am still stunned at the impact .
@ twitterid @ twitterid been there seen it , biblical , not fun
@ twitterid hope you 've caught up sleep .
long night for everyone .

documents.title: liberal democrat leader on the floods
text: i 've been to kendal to look at the extent of the flooding and speak to people who have been affected by the damage to their homes .
mr fallon told me he had asked the government to provide councils with money to help people `` who are in dire straits to get the basic equipment to be able to live their lives '' .
author: Yunus Mulla
Reporter, BBC North West Tonight

documents.title: coastguard helicopter joins rescue
text: coastguard helicopters from caernarfon and humberside operated all day and winched a disabled man from a flooded house on the outskirts of carlisle .
they also attended an incident in kendal where a member of the public was trapped under a bridge .

documents.title: a view of the cumbria floods from the air
text: cumbria floods from the air # stormdesmond # staysafe

documents.title: flood defences 'not good enough ' - workington mp
text: we were told these defences were fit for 1,000 years and they 've lasted for six .
it 's just not good enough .
we 've got to look and see what 's gone wrong , and why the flood defences have n't held . ''

documents.title: army involved in cumbria flood rescue
text: the army has been helping to rescue householders - and their pets - from the floods in cumbria .
members of the 2nd battalion duke of lancaster 's regiment , based in weeton barracks near preston , have been deployed .

documents.title: road closures due to flooding
text: # a69 in cumbria and northumberland is closed in both directions between the a689 ( # brampton ) and a6079 ( # hexham ) due to flooding .
@ twitterid the road is now open and has been since at least 12.00pm
@ twitterid our info has come from @ twitterid we 've just spoken with them and they advise the road remains closed .

documents.title: 'extremely difficult ' conditions for nhs
text: dr craig melrose , medical director for nhs england north , described the widespread flooding in cumbria as `` extremely difficult . ''
`` we 've been really grateful for all the staff who have come in and volunteered to do extra shifts and have made their way to work despite the floods , '' he said .
`` that 's definitely made a big difference to services they 've been able to deliver to patients , '' he added .
`` as it stands we 've got problems in all of the hospitals in the area .
the cumberland infirmary in carlisle and the rli ( royal lancaster infirmary ) in lancaster are running on generators . ''

documents.title: father tells of carlisle flooding rescue
text: david wildridge , his wife melanie and children maddie , 11 and ayden , aged nine - carrying his teddy bear , had grabbed a few bags and their dog before being rescued by boat from their home in the heart of carlisle earlier .
mr wildridge said emergency services were worried about a crack in a join between a flood defence wall and a bridge over the river eden close to their home .
our house is one of the last ones on the list , we 've been taken away in the last half hour .
we live very near to the bridge and the floodwater in the house came up through the floor , about a foot of water . ''

documents.title: rainfall totals revealed by environment agency
text: environment agency rain gauges have recorded widespread totals of more than 200mm across cumbria .
author: BBC Radio Cumbria

documents.title: extra resources for vehicle breakdowns
text: the aa has 50 patrols in action across cumbria and has brought in special 4x4 vehicles to help with more than 70 breakdowns .
edmund king , aa president , said : `` most of the roads are very hard to access due to submersion . ''
mr king said : `` in some areas of cumbria where possible we are asking members to call back once the floodwater has subsided . ''

documents.title: 'very heavy ' congestion on m6 exit slip road
text: very heavy congestion on the m6nb exit slip at j36 .
please slow down on approach & remember there is no access to a590 from this junction .

documents.title: environment agency staff in lancashire
text: we have 18 field staff at hall lane st michaels with 5 pumps.stay safe and do n't drive or walk through # flood waters

documents.title: rnli volunteers from all over the country helping
text: the rnli has released further details of its flood rescue operation , saying 27 volunteers from all over the country have carried out 200 rescues in cumbria .
eight boat crews are currently working in the county .

documents.title: only travel if necessary
text: cumbria county council is urging people not to drive unless absolutely necessary .
even though rain has subsided many roads are still closed and some bridges have been affected .
people are also being warned not to use bridges , even where water has subsided , because of the possibility of structural damage .
the warning comes after pooley bridge collapsed near penrith .

documents.title: advice on staying safe until power is restored
text: advice on how to stay safe until power is restored and floodwaters subside ( including food related tips ) :
@ twitterid @ twitterid this might be a stupid question but are the phone boxes working , no power means no phones charged to make calls

documents.title: cumbria rivers exceed highest values recorded
text: main rivers across cumbria have exceeded the highest values ever recorded :
the river eden ( at sands centre ) broke through the previous highest record of 4.85m , rising as high as 6.2m at about 23:30 on saturday .
similarly at keswick , the river greta ( greta bridge ) showed the highest ever recorded at 5.32m .
the previous record was 4.66m .
at carlisle , the eden is forecast to peak at 7.7 - 7.9m .
the previous highest recorded was 7.2m - this exceeds 2005 and 2009 .

documents.title: severe flood warning in lancashire
text: severe flood warning issued river wyre at st. michaels south # lancashire flooding is expected.take immediate action

text: workington cricket ground was hit by the floods .
here 's a photo taken earlier today - thanks to kevin h .

documents.title: public health 's flood water warning
text: cumbria county council 's public health is warning people to be careful around floodwater .
they are advising people :

documents.title: no need for planned power outages in carlisle
text: electricity north west said it had managed to protect the substation , preventing the need for planned shutdowns in carlisle .
plans were put in place to remove supplies to 5,000 customers at a time to prevent around 60,000 homes and businesses from being without power for some time .

electricity north west systems manager , chris fox , said : our engineers , with the help from partner agencies , have done an amazing job to protect the substation and power supplies to thousands of customers in carlisle . ''
it has restored power to more than 13,000 customers since the severe weather hit and 55,000 customers are still without power in lancaster .

text: squads at carlisle united will be offering a helping hand after their training session on tuesday , the club has confirmed .
they later tweeted that the u18s squad will be joining the first team in helping to clean up the city after floods devastated the area .

documents.title: about 2,000 'expected to be flooded ' says environment secretary
text: environment secretary elizabeth truss says flood defences in cumbria provided `` vital time '' for emergency services to evacuate homes and they are monitoring the situation in carlisle `` closely '' .
she said : `` we 're expecting upwards of 2,000 homes and businesses will have been flooded in north west england .
`` some areas are experiencing power cuts while other are difficult to reach because of severe disruption to travel . ''

documents.title: weather : dry and quiet but some rain expected later
text: it will be a dry and quiet start to the evening , however further cloud and patchy rain will spread northwards later , this lasting until the morning .
winds will stay fairly light .
minimum temperature : 3c ( 37f ) .
there are 45 severe flood warnings in place in the north west .

documents.title: rnli helps evacuate the homes of about 200 people
text: the rnli flood rescue team volunteers working in carlisle have evacuated about 200 people today , and expect to help 200 more by early evening .
rnli volunteer chris missen , who travelled to cumbria from porthcawl , south wales , to help the rescue effort , said the conditions were `` unprecedented '' .
`` the rnli currently has 30 people on the ground , with additional members on standby to relieve us as we have been on the go for around 24 hours .
`` it 's heart-breaking to see what this has done to people 's homes , especially just before christmas . ''
rnli flood rescue team evacuates 200 in 'unprecendented ' conditions .
latest news release :
rt @ twitterid rnli flood rescue team evacuates 200 in 'unprecendented ' conditions .

documents.title: lancashire school closures due to flooding
text: lancashire county council says 10 schools will be closed on monday due to flooding .
they are appletree nursery school , carnforth high school , great wood primary and lancaster girls ' grammar .
also closed are over kellet wilson 's endowed ce primary , quernmore ce voluntary controlled primary and scotforth st paul 's ce primary and nursery .
the final three closures are st peter 's ce primary , heysham , the cathedral catholic primary , lancaster .
and trumacar nursery and community primary in higher heysham .

documents.title: military at the scene in carlisle
text: military personnel have been moving into carlisle to help people evacuate their homes and those who are trapped by the flood water .

documents.title: video : couple show damage to flooded keswick home
text: a look inside one of the properties in keswick which has been damaged by flooding caused by storm desmond .
owners roger and julie scoon said they never dreamt the water would come into their house .

documents.title: power outages to begin in carlisle
text: planned power cuts are due to start in carlisle from about now .
the supply company electricity north west says it 's having to make them , to prevent 60,000 customers from losing power at once .
it 's expecting to turn off the supply for 5,000 customers at a time , for up to three hours .
the company says it 's trying to make best use of its assets that are n't affected by the flooding .

documents.title: breakingsudden death of woman , 70 , in lancaster
text: lancashire police said they are investigating the sudden death of a 70-year-old woman in lancaster this morning .
they were called to an address at alder court at 10:30 today by the ambulance service .
a spokesman told me it 's `` too early at this stage '' to determine if her death was related to flooding .
author: Helen Carter
Reporter, BBC News Online

documents.title: pooley bridge collapses in cumbria floods
text: pooley bridge near penrith has collapsed - see footage below .
the collapse of the bridge means about a 10-mile road journey to reach the other side of the bridge via penrith .

documents.title: in disruption caused by storm desmond
text: here is a gallery of capturing the fall-out as more than 1,000 people were evacuated , tens of thousands left without power and streets left underwater .

documents.title: cumbria university campuses to be closed
text: alert : our campuses in # carlisle , # ambleside and # lancaster will be closed tomorrow .

documents.title: army team from preston help flood response
text: about 350 army personnel have been made available from 2nd battalion duke of lancaster 's regiment , based in weeton barracks near preston , to assist with the general flooding response from the early hours .
they arrived with two vehicles to help evacuate and warn residents in carlisle - and sent a chinook helicopter to move high-velocity pumping equipment needed at an electricity substation .

documents.title: breakingpooley bridge collapses , police say
text: pooley bridge near penrith has collapsed , police say .
it is found next to the river eamont at the northern end of lake ullswater as it flows on to penrith .
`` the three-arch bridge was erected in 1764 , according to an inscription on a parapet stone .
`` it replaces a much earlier bridge dating back to the late 16th century , '' according to the britain express website .

documents.title: northern section of west coast main line 'closed for several days '
text: the west coast main line north of carlisle will remain closed for several days after eight feet of water flooded the railway .
the depth of the water , about two miles north of carlisle station , has reached its peak but is not expected to clear until tuesday .
a spokesman said : `` a number of safety-critical cabinets , which house complex electrical equipment , are currently submerged and will have to be rebuilt once it is safe to do so . ''
workers have been clearing trees , landslips and repairing flood damage .
passengers should check the national rail website before travelling .

documents.title: major incident declared by nhs trust
text: carlisle 's hospital is running on a backup generator - and the trust that runs it , north cumbria university hospitals nhs trust , has declared an internal major incident .
cumberland infirmary had lost power following damage to a substation in carlisle from water .
power has been lost to 50,000 properties in lancaster , including the royal lancaster infirmary which is running on reserve generators .
this is expected this to be the case for several days .
patients are being urged to only call 999 or go to a & e in carlisle or whitehaven if it 's an emergency .

documents.title: aerial photographs show extent of cumbria flooding
text: carlisle and the shocking sight of the main railway line under water .
the struggle to keep the lights on in carlisle - an electricity substation underwater
cockermouth 's christmas tree surrounded by flood water
author: David Shukman
Science editor, BBC News

documents.title: underwater search team deployed after report of man in water
text: an underwater search team is being deployed to the river kent at staveley to search for an elderly man thought to have fallen into water .
police were called at about 10:00 to staveley road , kendal , with a report that an elderly male had fallen in the water .

documents.title: power loss affecting some tap water supplies in lancaster
text: united utilities says the widespread power loss in lancaster following the flooding of an electricity north west substation has had an impact on some of the pumps used to transport water to customers ' taps .
about 80 customers are currently without water as a result and united utilities said they would be supplying bottled water to these properties .

documents.title: why is cumbria always so affected ?
text: weather reporter jon hammond explains why cumbria suffers such heavy floods .
`` unfortunately cumbria is uniquely positioned because it 's sticking out and exposed to south westerly winds .
`` the 90mph winds of desmond have sucked up moist humid air from the sub-tro and brought it up over the irish sea and the first bit of land it hits is cumbria .
`` that warm moist air is then pushed up , cools and then just drops as rain .
`` the people live in the valleys , 300mm of rain all congregates in the valleys and rushes down as a wave . ''

documents.title: families can bid for funding to help flood aftermath
text: tara booth from the cumbria community foundation is hoping to raise £ 1m to help families affected by the floods .
she said : `` we 're hoping to start giving out grants tomorrow - they 'll be able to apply for up-top £ 500 initially for anything they might need .
`` in 2009 we raised £ 3m - all of that money went back into the communities across cumbria to help them rebuild their lives . ''
more than 80,000 has been raised so far .

documents.title: lancaster bridge closed after container collision
text: lancashire county council is warning of a bridge closure after it was hit by a shipping container as a result of the flood water .
greyhound bridge # lancaster closed for safety reasons after being hit by shipping container carried by flood water .
we 'll reopen when we can
@ twitterid @ twitterid how was there a shipping container anywhere near greyhound bridge ?
@ twitterid is there any public transit into and out of lancaster at all ?

documents.title: flood defences will be assessed
text: the government 's emergency committee , cobra , has been meeting to oversee the deployment of troops and other resources after .
environment secretary elizabeth truss said the level of rainfall had been `` unprecedented ''
she said the immediate priority was to nake sure all the resources were in place to protect people and their home with a range of organisations woking together .
`` but of course , in due course we will be assessing our flood defences .
over the next six years we are investing £ 2.3bn in more flood defences to make sure people are protected . ''

documents.title: flood gates at garstang in operation
text: the environment agency north west has tweeted this of flood gates at garstang basin .
flood gates in operation at # garstang basin today .
remember stay # floodaware & stay safe in # lancashire & # cumbria
@ twitterid is there `` current status '' indicator anywhere online for the garstang flood gates ?
@ twitterid sorry nothing for the gate status online , we monitor the levels in our incident room .
@ twitterid the water should be used to generate electricity

documents.title: morecambe bay hospitals urge staff and public to help
text: a number of staff from the westmorland general hospital in kendal and the royal lancaster infirmary have been unable to get home or make it into work because of storm desmond , the hospital trust has said .

the university hospitals of morecambe bay nhs foundation trust said the military and mountain rescue teams had helped transport staff to and from work when they were n't able to do so safely themselves .
they urged staff to let them know if they are able to work today .
they asked the public to make sure staff `` are free to treat those most in need , such as those who have a serious illness or injury . ''

documents.title: flood defences were 'completely overwhelmed ' says mayor
text: mayor of keswick , paul titley , says 200 homes have been evacuated there .
he says : `` we 'd rather have a 1 in 100 year flood every 100 years , not every six - we were a bit surprised to get another one so soon .
`` i think the [ flood defences ] did work , but they were completely overwhelmed by the amount of rainwater we had .
`` the river was 5.4m above ground - in 2009 it was 4.6m . ''
author: Steven Bell
BBC Cumbria reporter

documents.title: risk of people being swept off feet in cockermouth
text: water is flowing quickly through cockermouth with a significant risk people could be knocked over , cumbria police warn .
insp craig lory , of cumbria police , said : `` the advice is not to return to the flooded areas at this stage .
`` for residents still in their houses , in flooded areas , you are asked to remain in your houses and not to venture into the floods .
`` the rescue services are able to get to everyone if needs be .

but if there is an emergency or a need to be evacuated can residents call the emergency services in the first instance , or draw attention to themselves from within their houses , by shouting from windows , only venturing into places that are clearly safe . ''

documents.title: dozens of homes flooded in northumberland
text: more than 70 homes have been flooeded and 50 homes have been evacuated in northumberland , police say .
in corbridge and bellingham 73 homes have been flooded and 59 evacuated .
a rest centre is still in place at priory school , hexham , for affected people .
police are remaining in the area to support residents .

documents.title: 'very extreme and unprecedented event ' says mp
text: rory stewart is the conservative mp for penrith and the border - and an environment minister with responsibility for floods policy .
he said new flood barriers had been in place , but the water had gone over the top of them .
he said : `` this is a very extreme and unprecedented event .
early indications suggest we 've passed the uk record on rainfall in cumbria .
`` and the number one objective at the moment is making sure that we can protect people 's lives .
`` we 've got mountain rescue out , we 've got fire and rescue out , the police are out , the army is now here at carlisle .
so there 's a very , very serious response . ''

documents.title: schools closed in cumbria tomorrow and flooding advice
text: some primary and seconday schools in cumbria will be closed tomorrow because of flooding - see the full list here .
cumbria county council has a page with advice for people affected by the flooding .
you can find the latest forecasts on the bbc weather page and the latest on the roads and rails on the bbc travel page .
cumbria is running updates throughout the day - you can listen online .

author: BBC Travel

documents.title: scoons face second flood repairs
text: roger and julie scoon have seen their home in keswick flooded out for the second time since 2009 .
mr scoon said water reached up to 1m deep and was flowing out of the fireplace like a waterfall .
now they have returned to their home , which they are trying to sell , to assess the damage .
mr scoon said : `` we are trying to get the mud out and salvage anything we can .
`` we had someone buying the house until yesterday , they have n't told us yet but i imagine they will pull out .
`` all we can do now is get it back to something nice .

documents.title: water being pumped to prevent substation from flooding
text: electricity north west says its engineers and partner agencies are working to safeguard power supplies to 60,000 properties in carlisle .

fire engines are currently pumping water from the major substation that serves the area and extra pumps and sandbags are on their way to the site after the river eden burst its banks and floodwater threaten to breach defences .

documents.title: cricket club almost submerged from river eden
text: here are photos from earlier - carlisle cricket club almost submerged in water from the river eden .
this fridge freezer has also washed up on the river banks of the river eden .

documents.title: fund to help those hit by cumbria floods raises nearly £ 77,000
text: an appeal set up to help people devastated by the flooding in cumbria has raised almost £ 77,000 .
it has been set up by the cumbria community foundation , which says it has committed £ 50,00 from its onw funds .
it says the money will be used to help people to clean up , emergeny repairs , clothing , food and drink and heating .
author: Fiona Trott
BBC News

documents.title: residents rescued in corbridge
text: woman rescued from flooded house in # corbridge .
fire fighters say they have 5 more to rescue here .
# stormdesmond
@ twitterid @ twitterid that 's my mam and dad !
@ twitterid @ twitterid lovely couple .
spoke to both after the rescue .
@ twitterid @ twitterid they are indeed !

documents.title: farron calls for government aid
text: lib dem leader and the mp for south lakeland tim farron is calling for government funding to help cumbria deal with the aftermath of storm desmond .
he said : `` it is heartbreaking to see the impact of flooding once more on local people .
my thoughts are with all those whose homes and businesses have been flooded , and who have been forced to evacuate .
there is now a major task ahead of us in terms of repairing the damage caused by these floods , and i am calling on the government to support us in this and make additional funds available . ''

documents.title: video : aerial footage of cumbria floods
text: aerial footage filmed from the bbc helicopter shows the scale of the floods in cumbria .

documents.title: number of severe flood warnings falling
text: we 're starting to see the number of severe # flood warnings fall , 48 now in force with the majority for # cumbria .
# desmond chris f

documents.title: concerns about further rainfall in the week
text: weather 's john hammond has been in keswick , in cumbria .
he said : `` in terms of rainfall , it 's totally dry here now and will generally remain so for the rest of the day , but we are concerned about further rainfall through this week .
`` there is more heavy rain in the forecast for flood affected areas in the next few days and river levels downstream could be adversely affected . ''
for the latest forecasts visit the bbc weather website .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: cumbria police : 'this is an exceptional situation '
text: mark pannone , from cumbria police , said : `` this is an exceptional situation , it 's a major incident for cumbria .
`` the military are helping us with warning and informing people .
and we would ask people to listen to what they 're saying .
`` and when you 're being told to get out of your houses to go to the reception centres , please do because that 's the safest thing for you to do . ''

documents.title: part of a591 washes away
text: ken leech from kendal sent us this photo of the a591 north of dunmail raise at thirlmere .

documents.title: workington flood victim : 'have to start again '
text: marion telford in workington has seen her house get flooded for the second time .
`` at about 01:00 the water started coming over the wall , it was a bit scar '' , she said .
`` i will now phone my insurance , find somewhere to stay and start again .
`` i had a cry last night but you 've got to get on with it .
`` it took us 10 months to get in last time so it will be the end of summer before we get back in . ''
author: Mark McAlindon
BBC Look North

documents.title: 'valley looks like a lagoon '
text: reporter christian fraser has been in keswick this morning .
he said : `` parts of the town are still cut off and the whole valley floor around keswick looks like a lagoon .
`` they have had a month 's rain in just over 24 hours .
`` the water in the river greta has retreated a couple of feet over past hour in some parts .
`` the town centre is dismal this morning , trees washed up and mud deposited . ''

documents.title: man rescues dog in corbridge
text: man wades through water to rescue dog trapped in flood water in # corbridge .
fire brigade on way to rescue wife .

documents.title: power substation 'likely ' to be flooded , police say
text: a power substation is `` quite likely '' to be flooded which could leave tens of thousands without power , cumbria police say .
the search and rescue mission is continuing with help from the military .
it is likely that the rivers will rise later this afternoon and rescue teams are going house-to-house in carlisle .

documents.title: emergency services dealing with `` extreme events ''
text: i 've been speaking to the environment agency and the police here in carlisle .
they told me they 're dealing with `` extreme events '' after `` significant rainfall '' .
latest from @ twitterid in carlisle

author: Danny Savage

documents.title: reports of elderly man falling in water
text: an elderly male may have fallen in the water at the river kent in kendal , police say .
police were called at 10.01 to staveley road - and emergency services are working to establish if anyone is in the water .
motorists are asked to avoid the area and use alternative routes .

documents.title: potential gas leak in prudhoe
text: northumbria police have received a report of a potential gas leak in prudhoe , northumberland .
at around 10:00 this morning police received of a suspected gas leak from sca hygiene on princess way .
the a695 princess road has been closed as a precaution and pedestrians are also advised to avoid the area .
residents in the immediate area are advised to keep windows shut .

teams are working to ensure a swift response and help for those who need it .

documents.title: residents urged to keep phones fully charged
text: at 22:00 last night they were telling us the water was up to the top of the flood barriers and at about midnight it came spilling over .
thousands of properties are without electricity - a hospital in lancaster is running on generator power and there are worries about a substation in carlisle .
residents are being told to keep phones fully charged now - if that substation goes , 60,000 properties could be left without power .
author: Danny Savage
North of England correspondent

documents.title: carlisle flooding 'appears to be worse than 2005 '
text: coastguards and lifeboats are in the centre of carlisle .
this city has seen it all before but it does n't make it any easier .
i left warwick road about 01:00 with water rising rapidly .
by 09:00 it had spread much further towards the city - this appears to be worse than 2005 .
the army are here to help after the police went wading door to door in the early hours making sure residents were at least safe .
later , rescue teams with boats arrived to move those people who did want to leave .
they had watched the modern flood defences anxiously for hours .
author: Danny Savage
North of England correspondent

documents.title: cobra emergency meeting to discuss flooding
text: the environment agency says the deluge of rainfall brought by storm desmond may have set a new uk record as well as rendering many flood defences inadequate .
hundreds of people have been moved from their homes in northern england and southern scotland .
tens of thousands of families are without electricity .
the government 's civil emergency committee , cobra , is meeting to discuss how to deal with the crisis .
more than 50 severe flood warnings are in place - meaning there 's a risk to life .
cumbria is one of the areas worst affected , and the british red cross has set up rest centres in keswick , appleby and kendal .
author: Emily Unia
BBC reporter

documents.title: substation flooding leaves 55,000 lancaster homes without power
text: about 55,000 homes around lancaster are without power and could be cut off for days after an electricity substation was flooded during storm desmond .
electricity north west said flood defences upgraded five years ago to cope with a `` one-in-a-hundred years flood '' were breached on saturday night .
engineers are working with the fire service to determine when it is safe to access the substation in caton road .
operations director mark williamson , said it was `` fully submerged '' .
author: Emma Stanley
Reporter, BBC News Online

documents.title: water pouring over flood defences in carlisle
text: stuart david tweeted us these photos of carlisle .
earlier he said : `` water pouring over the flood defences at old brewery carlisle into willowholme .
`` river caldew and petteril definitely receding . ''

documents.title: cars submerged in corbridge
text: some cars are under 4ft ( 1.2m ) of water in the south of corbridge .
the fire brigade is on the way to rescue people trapped in the pub opposite .
author: Anthony Day
BBC Newcastle

documents.title: your photos : flooding in lancashire
text: eve bennett sent us this at newton in bowland in lancashire .
if you have any photos tweet them to @ bbcnewsne with details of where it is but please make sure you do n't put yourself in any danger .

documents.title: river 'back behind defences in keswick '
text: dan potts in keswick tells us : `` water was still coming over the wall at 04:00 , but now has completely gone .
`` the river is now back inside defences , just on with the clear up now , '' he says .

documents.title: carlisle 's warwick road becomes a river
text: here 's warwick road in carlisle - a river .
mountain rescue teams are among those helping to take people to safety .
author: Alison Freeman
BBC Look North

documents.title: weather : isolated showers but should be largely dry
text: aside from the odd , isolated shower , it should be largely dry and bright through the rest of the day , with the wind easing too , but impacts will continue to be felt in many areas .
maximum temperature : 10c ( 50f ) .
the met office has yellow warnings in place as the amber and red warnings have expired .
red & amber weather warnings have expired but rivers will be in flood for longer .
latest flood map here darren
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: two main bridges in lancaster damaged by flood water
text: the greyhound and skerton bridges in lancaster are out of action as a result of damage from flooding , access only to emergency responders
@ twitterid how do we get news about when the bridges are going to be reopened ?
@ twitterid @ twitterid good lord it must be high to reach greyhound bridge !
@ twitterid @ twitterid

documents.title: ferry rescued after engine failure
text: the cross-tyne ferry had to be rescued after its engine failed and it was carried off in a `` howling gale '' .
the tynemouth rnli lifeboat went to the aid of the spirit of the tyne at 23:30 on saturday as it made its final crossing between north and south shields .
a small number of passengers were rescued by the port of tyne pilot boat before the ferry , manned only by the captain , was blown into a river bank .

there was further drama when the tow rope being used by the lifeboat to pull the ferry snapped and the powerless ferry started to drift again , but the pilot joined the rescue and the ferry was returned to south shields .
author: Duncan Leatherdale
BBC News Online

documents.title: 'worse than 2009 floods ' , say rescue team
text: in november 2009 unprecedented rainfall caused rivers to burst their banks , flooding towns and villages .
gary parsons , bay search and rescue in cumbria told bbc radio cumbria this morning : `` my gut feeling is this was worse than what we dealt with in 2009 .
`` the area affected is just enormous . ''
damage to homes , businesses and infrastructure caused by the cumbrian floods in 2009 ( in a £ 276m bill .

documents.title: engineers 'working round the clock ' to restore power
text: about 60,000 properties in lancaster , morecambe , carnforth and the surrounding area could be without power for `` a number of days '' following flooding to a major electricity substation in lancaster , electricity north west has said .
engineers have been working `` around the clock '' to repair damage to overhead power lines and electricity substations caused by severe gales and flooding in cumbria and lancaster .
they are working with lancashire fire and rescue service to determine when it is safe to access the flooded substation in lancaster .

documents.title: latest photos from carlisle after flooding
text: residents and emergency services in carlisle have been coming to terms this morning with the severe flooding there .
here are some of the latest photos :

documents.title: lancashire fire service advice for flooded homes
text: some information about what you can do if your property is affected by flood water .

documents.title: cumbria police : some road closed signs being removed
text: cumbria police say they have received reports of road closed signs being removed and motorists continuing to drive through `` dangerous and partially-blocked '' roads .
they warn it is putting lives at risk .
they say that although the rain has subsided in the south of the county , the river kent remains high and a large number of roads including the a590 at brettargh halt remain impassable..
motorists are asked not to drive through any flood water .
members of the public are asked to check on their neighbours , elderly and the vulnerable in their area before calling for emergency service assistance .

documents.title: view of flooded carlisle from above
text: this image of a heavily-flooded carlisle was sent in by bob stinger .
he 's a pilot and flight instructor , hence the lofty views of the landscape .

documents.title: 'stay indoors and charge mobile devices ' , say police
text: cumbria police are warning residents of carlisle to stay indoors and not travel but to charge their mobile devices .
cumbria police along with military and mountain rescue teams are warning and informing residents in carlisle who could be affected by flooding .
they are advising people to self-evacuate to family/friends or attend one of the reception centres in carlisle .
cumbria county council have collated flooding advice on their website .

documents.title: lancashire river levels 'starting to fall '
text: the environment agency says water levels on the river wyre and the river lune peaked on saturday evening and are now falling .
the rivers will remain high throughout sunday but no further property flooding is expected .
the river ribble has also peaked and is being monitored .

documents.title: dozens rescued after floods in cumbria
text: maryport coastguard rescue team helped evacuate 120 people trapped on a river bank at a residential park at penrith after their caravans flooded
helicopters from prestwick and humber worked through the night to rescue people from flooded homes and vehicles in carlisle .
here a family and their dog are rescued by the coastguard on warwick road in the centre of carlisle :

documents.title: breakingcumbria police : 'major risk of electricity substations flooding '
text: breaking police say there 's a major risk that two electricity substations could flood in carlisle , which could cut power to 60,000 homes
@ twitterid # stormdesmond the people 's views cumbria kendal cockermouth appleby # storms and # flloods hit rt
@ twitterid do u think we will get aid from other countries like we help when they have a disaster i think not

documents.title: truck overturns on m6 in cumbria
text: there is disruption on the m6 near shap after a truck was blown on to its side .
more traffic updates on the bbc travel website .

documents.title: river eden bursts its banks
text: the river eden has burst its banks and this is the scene about 100 yards away - this is usually a busy roundabout in the centre of carlisle .
the ground floor of the civic centre is flooded .

documents.title: follow the latest on bbc cumbria
text: live updates on bbc radio cumbria 95.6 fm carlisle 96.1 fm morecambe bay 104.1 fm whitehaven/keswick 95.2 fm kendal 104.2 fm windermere
@ twitterid can you tell us if roads are passable on foot ?
i 'm stuck without power but if roads are open to pedestrians we need to know

documents.title: power company working to restore power to 60,000 homes
text: # powercut numbers update .
we expect to restore 'storm ' faults today .
'flooding ' faults may take significantly longer

documents.title: storm desmond 'difficult time for emergency services '
text: lancashire fire and rescue service said storm desmond has proved to be `` a really difficult time for all emergency services '' .
chief fire officer chris kenny said their efforts focussed on moving vulnerable people who were stranded where ambulances could n't get through .
`` our focus then was trying to stop the power outage at the lancaster substation , '' he said .
`` you 're battling against rising water and it 's relentless . ''

documents.title: carlisle river levels due to peak in next 25 minutes
text: river levels in carlisle are due to peak in the next 25 minutes

documents.title: major rail disruption between preston and carlisle
text: virgin trains say flooding and a landslip between preston and carlisle means services are unable to run between preston and scotland in either direction .

they advise passengers intending to travel north of preston or south from glasgow and edinburgh via the west coast should not attempt to travel today as no replacement road transport will be available .

documents.title: military personnel are at the scene in carlisle
text: military vehicle just turned onto stanhope road from wigton road # cumbriaflood @ twitterid

documents.title: flood water drops in keswick
text: the rain has stopped in keswick and the flood water has dropped .
there is a lot of wind in the town this morning .
fridges , freezers , furniture has been flowing down the river here at the river greta , the mountain rescue teams have been telling me .
however , we 're expecting better weather and then the clean up operation will begin .
author: Fiona Trott
BBC News

documents.title: many carlisle roads blocked due to flooding
text: shaddongate is impassable at the maltings (
there is a diversion onto junction street .
keep up to date with all of the travel information here .
devonshire walk still inundated with water as shown here .
author: Lee Macaulay
Journalist, BBC Radio Cumbria

documents.title: travel : trains cancelled between preston and carlisle
text: there are no train services between preston and carlisle this morning due to the severe weather .
train operators are advising customers not to travel unless they have to .
more from bbc travel
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: river levels expected to peak after 09:00 say environment agency
text: the environment agency says river levels are not expected to peak until after 09:00 .
the road to crosby from the airport road in carlisle is completely underwater .
author: Emma Borthwick
BBC Radio Cumbria presenter

documents.title: travel : slip roads closed on m6 in north lancashire
text: two exit slip roads are closed on the m6 in north lancashire due to flooding .
junction 33 for the a6 galgate and junction 34 for the a683 lancaster are both affected .
more from bbc travel .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: eight reception centres open in cumbria
text: here are details of the eight reception areas open in cumbria .
they include appleby , carlisle , cockermouth , kendal , keswick , penrith , windermere and workington .
police are warning people to stay away from swollen rivers .
if you 're travelling , check flood risk before setting off and do n't drive through floodwater
hardwicke circus in the centre of carlisle is under water as river eden bursts it banks .

documents.title: thousands of homes without power in lancashire and cumbria
text: latest number of properties with a # powercut by area from our incident room .
# stormdesmond # cumbriafloods # lancaster
@ twitterid out of interest , do you have a total figure for how many properties you supply electricity to when everything is okay ?
@ twitterid we maintain the electricity supply 2.4 million properties in the north west !
@ twitterid thanks for all you 're doing in such atrocious weather .
@ twitterid do n't envy your guys and girls being out here sorting this .
stay safe !

documents.title: your photos : flooding in carlisle
text: cheryl corson sent us this photo of the scene at kingfisher park off warwick road in carlisle last night .
if you have any photos tweet them to @ twitterid details of where it is but please make sure you do n't put yourself in any danger .

documents.title: fire service takes more than 300 calls for help during the night
text: lancashire fire and rescue service said the county 's firefighters dealt with more than 300 calls for help in lancaster and surrounding areas as flooding hit the cable street , water street , chapel street , damside street and st george 's quay parts of the city centre last night .

crews from all over the lancaster and morecambe district attended a range of situations including helping cars stuck in floodwater , affected electrics , flooding and road traffic collisions and two fires .

documents.title: met office : 'a month 's worth of rain ' in 24 hours
text: marco petagna , a senior forecaster at the met office , said parts of cumbria and lancashire have been hit with more than a month 's worth of rain in just 24 hours - and warned more was on the way .
he said the weather in the north west should improve today , but fresh downpours were forecast for monday and another weather warning has been put in place .

documents.title: 'could be days ' before lancaster power restored
text: mark williamson , operations director for electricity north west , has said a substation on caton road in lancaster is fully submerged by floodwater .
he said : `` the water has to receed before we can assess the damage .
until we can get in there we wo n't know .
`` we 're hoping it will be lunchtime but it could be days before power is restored . ''

documents.title: carlisle flooding : military to help residents
text: military personnel are being brought in to deal with flooding in carlisle - the army are out warning and informing residents .
there are still 54 severe flood warnings for cumbria covering at least the rivers greta , eden , derwent , cocker , caldew , petteril , and eamont .
here 's the scene currently at west walls in carlisle looking down to viaduct car park .
author: Steven Bell
BBC Cumbria reporter

documents.title: hundreds spend night in reception centres
text: hundreds of people in cumbria have spent the night in reception centres after storm desmond swept through the county causing severe flooding .
cumbria police declared a major incident yesterday , and many communities have been badly affected by rising waters , including appleby , keswick , cockermouth and kendal .
in carlisle , hardwicke circus and caldewgate are underwater .
the environment agency says at least 80 properties have flooded across cumbria , and it 's expecting that figure to rise
author: Steven Bell
BBC Cumbria reporter

documents.title: substation flooding leaves 55,000 lancaster homes without power
text: about 55,000 homes in lancaster are without power this morning after an electricity substation was flooded in last night 's heavy rain .
electricity north west said flood defences upgraded five years ago to cope with a `` one-in-a-hundred years flood '' were breached late last night .
author: Emma Stanley
Reporter, BBC News Online

documents.title: wind and rain seems stronger and heavier than yesterday
text: i 'm in keswick in cumbria this morning and the e of storm desmond is due to hit cumbria at about 08:00 and you can actually feel that right now .
the wind is stronger than it was yesterday , the rain seems heavier .
you get the impression though , the flooding may have subsided overnight , because where i 'm standing now there would have been flood water .
now you can just see silt .
but the rain is again coming in very , very heavily now .
author: Fiona Trott
BBC News

documents.title: storm desmond : what we know so far
text: here 's a summary of what 's happening as a result of the heavy rainfall caused by storm desmond hitting the uk so far this weekend .
cumbria has been worst hit , with more than 1,000 people evacuated from their homes in the county and in the scottish borders .
more than 50 severe flood warnings are in place with water levels expected to peak in carlisle at about 09:15 gmt .
more than 60,000 residents are without power in lancaster , lancashire , and large parts of cumbria
eight rescue centres have been opened in the county as the emergency services battle against rising flood waters .

documents.title: good morning . welcome to our live coverage
text: we 'll be bringing you live updates for the north east and cumbria after storm desmond hit parts of the uk .
if you have any photos email us , tweet us @ twitterid @ twitterid contact us via facebook .
you can catch up with developments overnight here .
author: Lloyd Watson
BBC Local Live
